content: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?>  <reference anchor='I-D.adel-vpn-service-management-model'> <front> <title>VPN Service Management YANG Data Model</title>  <author initials='D' surname='Zhang' fullname='Dacheng Zhang'>     <organization /> </author>  <author initials='A' surname='Zaalouk' fullname='Adel Zaalouk'>     <organization /> </author>  <author initials='K' surname='Pentikousis' fullname='Kostas Pentikousis'>     <organization /> </author>  <date month='January' day='29' year='2015' />  <abstract><t>Currently new services create new opportunities for both network providers and service providers. Shared Unified Policy Automation (SUPA) was proposed to develop a model that abstracts network resources and services and a methodology by which the management and monitoring of network services can be done using standardized policy rules. This document defines a VPN service management yang data model and gives an example for DDC use case.</t></abstract>  </front>  <seriesInfo name='Internet-Draft' value='draft-adel-vpn-service-management-model-00' /> <format type='TXT'         target='http://www.ietf.org/internet-drafts/draft-adel-vpn-service-management-model-00.txt' /> </reference>
